words.definition: If you are astounded, you are very surprised.
words.example: I was astounded by the beautiful view from the top of the mountain.

words.definition: An attribute is a characteristic of a person or thing.
words.example: He isn’t very clever, but he does have some other positive attributes.

words.definition: If someone is bilingual, then they can speak two languages.
words.example: Since you already know English, after learning French you’ll be bilingual.

words.definition: A clone is an identical copy of a living creature.
words.example: Scientists recently made a clone of a sheep.

words.definition: Colloquial describes informal words that are more suitable for speech than writing.
words.example: I find it difficult to understand people if they use colloquial language.

words.definition: Cosmetics are substances that women put on their faces to look more beautiful.
words.example: She spent a lot of money on cosmetics at the beauty store.

words.definition: To dash means to run or move quickly.
words.example: He made a dash for the bus before it pulled away.

words.definition: Disgust is a feeling of very strong dislike or disapproval.
words.example: He looked at the messy room with a look of disgust.

words.definition: Fluorescent lights are very bright and produce little heat.
words.example: The fluorescent lights in the office were too bright for me.

words.definition: If you are furious, you are extremely angry.
words.example: My father was furious when he saw the broken window.

words.definition: A gulf is a gap between people or a large area of ocean.
words.example: There is a wide gulf between the rich and the poor.

words.definition: Humanities are subjects which involve the study of culture and ideas.
words.example: She decided to study humanities like history and literature.

words.definition: A knot is a place where two ends of something are tied together.
words.example: He tied a knot in the rope to keep it from slipping.

words.definition: A linguist is a person who studies languages.
words.example: The linguist was able to speak several different languages fluently.

words.definition: A participant is someone who takes part in something.
words.example: There were many participants in the local marathon.

words.definition: If something is plausible, it is reasonable or possible.
words.example: It is a plausible explanation for why the car won't start.

words.definition: A ritual is a formal custom that people do regularly.
words.example: Brushing my teeth is part of my morning ritual.

words.definition: A sibling is a brother or a sister.
words.example: How many siblings do you have?

words.definition: If someone is skinny, they are very thin.
words.example: He was so skinny that his clothes didn't fit him properly.

words.definition: If something is vague, it is not clear or distinct.
words.example: I have only a vague memory of my first day of school.
